I don’t trust stairs. They are always up to something.
When does a joke become a 'dad joke?' When it becomes apparent.
I sold our vacuum cleaner; it was just gathering dust.
I searched for a lighter on Amazon, but all I could find was 401 matches.
A friend of mine didn't pay his exorcist. He got repossessed.
What’s the best way to watch a fly-fishing tournament? Live stream.
Why do dogs float in water? Because they are good buoys.
Why do cows wear bells? Because their horns don't work.
Did you hear about the restaurant on the moon? Great food, no atmosphere!
Did you hear the rumor about butter? Well, I'm not going to spread it!
What do you call a bear with no teeth? A gummy bear.
Q: If athletes get athlete's foot, what do astronauts get? A: Missile toe.
If you see a robbery at an Apple Store does that make you an iWitness?
What’s orange and sounds like a parrot? A carrot.
What’s brown and sticky? A stick.
How you fix a broken pumpkin? With a pumpkin patch.
I hated facial hair but then it grew on me.
How do you throw a party in outer space? You planet.
You can't trust atoms. They make up everything!
If a child refuses to nap, are they guilty of resisting a rest?
Can a kangaroo jump higher than a house? Of course, houses can't jump.
It is certain

The best way to predict the future is to invent it. - Alan Kay
Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute. - Harold Abelson
Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans understand. - Martin Fowler
Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live. - John Woods
I'm not a great programmer; I'm just a good programmer with great habits. - Kent Beck
Weeks of programming can save you hours of planning. - Unknown
Code is there to explain the comments to the computer. - Andy Harris
Some people, when confronted with a problem, think 'I know, I'll user regular expressions.' Now they have two problems. - Jamie Zawinski
Slow is smooth. Smooth is fast. - Mitsuyo Maeda
The future is already here - it's just not evenly distributed. - William Gibson
When you want to know how things really work, study them when they're falling apart. - William Gibson
The street finds its own use for things. - William Gibson
See, the world is full of things more powerful than us. But if you know how to catch a ride, you can go places. - Neal Stephenson
Well, all information looks like noise until you break the code. - Neal Stephenson
Your assumptions are your windows on the world. Scrub them off every once and a while, or the light won't come in. - Isaac Asimov
Those people who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do. - Isaac Asimov
Never attempt to teach a pig to sing; it wastes your time and annoys the pig. - Robert Heinlein
There ain't no such thing as a free lunch. - Robert Heinlein
Always listen to experts. They'll tell you what can't be done, and why. Then do it. - Robert Heinlein
A society that gets rid of all its troublemakers goes downhill. - Robert Heinlein
Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a function. - Garrison Keillor
Experience is a hard teacher because she gives you the test first, the lesson afterwards. - Vernon Sanders Law
It is not a shame for a man to learn that which he knows not, whatever his age. - Socrates
Do not mess with science - we have lasers! - The Optical Society
Everywhere is walking distance if you have the time. - Steven Wright
Doing your best is more important than being the best. - Zig Ziglar
An expert is somebody who knows more and more about less and less. - Unknown
To the man who only has a hammer, everything he encounters begins to look like a nail. - Abraham Maslow
We are what we repeatedly do; excellence, then, is not an act but a habit. - Aristotle
The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity. - Ellen Parr
You must be the change you wish to see in the world. - Gandhi
We've heard that a million monkeys at a million keyboards could produce the complete works of Shakespeare; now, thanks to the Internet, we know that is not true. - Robert Wilensky
You miss 100 percent of the shots you never take. - Wayne Gretzky
Imagination is more important than knowledge. - Albert Einstein
Make it as simple as possible but no simpler. - Albert Einstein
You can't solve a problem with the same kind of thinking that created it. - Albert Einstein
It's difficult to work in a group when you're omnipotent. - Q from Star Trek
Everything starts as somebody's daydream - Larry Niven
Do what you can, with what you have, where you are. - Theodore Roosevelt
Always do right. This will gratify some people and astonish the rest. - Mark Twain
Life is a do-it-yourself project. - Unknown
Nothing endures but change. - Heraclitus
A witty saying proves nothing. - Voltaire
It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity. - Einstein Albert
Do, or do not. There is no 'try'. - Yoda
A mathematician is a device for turning coffee into theorems. - Paul Erdos
